intro: Coussarea ilheotica, commonly known as the Ilheus coussarea, is a flowering plant native to the Brazilian state of Bahia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its leaves are elliptical with a smooth texture, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
